sentences: See krahv on kuulus oma kunstikogu poolest.
Tal oli krahvitiitel oma suguvõsast päritud.
context: The Estonian word 'krahv' is a masculine noun that means either 'count' or 'earl' in English, referring to a noble title. It can refer to historical nobility or fictional characters with this title. In Estonian, it follows normal grammatical patterns for nouns and would have different forms depending on case and number.
